question.title: How to connect to MCP server (Transport type: Streamable HTTP) in MCP Inspector (v0.17.2)
question.body:
I have this local MCP-server and I want to test with this MCP Inspector, I followed this tutorial but it does not work.

Got this following error.

My MCP-server written in java (Spring boot) using:

<dependency> 
    <groupId>org.springframework.ai</groupId> 
    <artifactId>spring-ai-starter-mcp-server-webflux</artifactId> 
</dependency>

McpApplication.java

@SpringBootApplication  
public class McpApplication {  
  
    public static void main(String args) {  
        SpringApplication.run(McpApplication.class, args);  
    }  
  
    @Bean  
    public ToolCallbackProvider employeeTools(EmployeeService employeeService) {  
        return MethodToolCallbackProvider.builder().toolObjects(employeeService).build();  
    }  
}

ToolService.java

@Service  
@RequiredArgsConstructor  
@Slf4j  
public class EmployeeService {  
  
private final SomeRepository someRepository;  
  
@Tool(description ="Tool Description")  
public Flux<ResponseChunk> toolMethod( Param param) {       
     // Tool implementation here.  
}  
}

And these are config option.


spring.ai.mcp.server.enabled=true spring.ai.mcp.server.name=filter-mcp-server spring.ai.mcp.server.version=0.0.1 spring.ai.mcp.server.protocol=STREAMABLE spring.ai.mcp.server.type=ASYNC spring.ai.mcp.server.endpoint=/mcp spring.ai.mcp.server.stdio=false

Need some help!
